intro: Pleurothallis fritillaria, commonly known as the Fritillaria orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees, drawing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. The plant features delicate, pendulous inflorescences with small, fragrant flowers that are often white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually clustered at the base and are covered in a fine, hairy texture. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts and botanists.
